message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with image processing and computer vision, specifically the problem of single image reflection separation. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a novel network architecture based on adversarial learning, which falls under the category of generative models, making cs.GR (Graphics) another likely sub-category. The paper also uses deep learning techniques, which could fall under cs.MM (Multimedia), and the proposed weakly supervised learning approach could fall under cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper addresses an ill-posed problem, which could involve some level of reasoning and decision-making, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category as well.
